text: most people don't realize that one of
the greatest challenges in the context
of IOT is having an application in its
developer speak the same language that a
device is speaking the second key
problem is actually filtering the data
so that an application and
decision-makers really are interacting
with the data that matters so speak the
same language and tell me really what I
need to know that's one of the biggest
problems that we solve machine shop is a
software company we have a very simple
mission that is to make it as simple as
possible for organizations to enable and
integrate their IOT data and manage the
systems that are generating it when we
started the business four and a half
years ago we started right on AWS much
like AWS we're a hundred percent API
centric business so every element of
functionality that we've created was
built as a discrete functional service
with its own API machine shop made the
decision to apply for AWS IOT competency
recently for a variety of reasons one is
we wanted a visible demonstration to AWS
into its ecosystem partners and
customers how committed we were too deep
and meaningful integration of our
technology with AWS it's a forcing
function for us to make sure we are
constantly in tune with the evolving
roadmap and capabilities of AWS IMT we
see a world that is highly distributed
and therefore requires both cloud and
edge technology which really allows
customers that have a distributed
enterprise and distributed architecture
to leverage technologies from both
machine shop and AWS
you
